text: Althea Louise Brough Clapp (March 11, 1923 – February 3, 2014) was an American tennis player, once ranked world no. 1. She was born in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma but moved to Beverly Hills, California when she was four years old. Brough Clapp appeared in six singles finals at the U.S. Championships, but won only in 1947. She had a match point at 6–5 in the third set of the 1948 final against duPont. She also had three match points in the 1954 final against Hart, the first at 5–4 in the third set and two more at 6–5 in that set. She was inducted in the International Tennis Hall of Fame in 1967. Brough died at her home in Vista, California, on February 3, 2014, at the age of 90. ==References== ==Other websites== *International Tennis Hall of Fame Category:1923 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American tennis players Category:Australian Open champions Category:French Open champions Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles County, California Category:Sportspeople from Oklahoma City Category:US Open (tennis) champions Category:Wimbledon champions Category:World No. 1 tennis players
title: Louise Brough
